intro: Bupleurum graminifolium var. globosum, commonly known as the globular bupleurum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic compounds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has finely divided, grass-like leaves. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. This variant is distinguished by its rounded, globe-like inflorescences, which give it its specific name.
